title: Headcorn Walks

images.title: David Anstiss / River Beult near Headcorn
images.caption: River Beult near Headcorn. Seen from footbridge from Church Walk to New House Farm. River winds it through the Weald countryside towards Smarden.

images.title: Thomas Grant / South of Headcorn station
images.caption: South of Headcorn station. Taken from the footbridge on a gorgeous autumn evening. The balloon is one of many that were taking part in a rally at the nearby airfield.

images.title: David Anstiss / Bletchenden Cottage, Waterman Quarter
images.caption: Bletchenden Cottage, Waterman Quarter. This long house used to be a row of cottages. Close to Bletchenden Manor Farm.

images.title: Oast House Archive / Longbarn Oast, Bletchenden, Headcorn, Kent
images.caption: Longbarn Oast, Bletchenden, Headcorn, Kent

images.title: David Anstiss / Footbridge over River Beult, near the Dairy
images.caption: Footbridge over River Beult, near the Dairy. This bridge is on a footpath from Bletchenden, Waterman Quarter to Headcorn Railway Station. The Dairy is a large milk processing factory on the otherside of the river.

images.title: Headcorn by Roger Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Village Street. The village is of some historical significance as it is was where Winston Churchill stayed when he was Chancellor during the First World War. The villagers also came out to feed the troops on their way home following the Dunkirk evacuation in 1940.

images.title: High Street - Headcorn by Brian Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: High Street

images.title: Mustang at Headcorn Airfield by Peter Skynner, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mustang at Headcorn Airfield

description: This historic village is located in the Low Weald area of Kent, a few miles south of Sutton Valence. This circular walk starts from the train station in the village and explores the area to the south of the settlement. On the way you will enjoy views of the surrounding countryside and the River Beult. The route runs for just over 2 miles, using public footpaths running through the area. Also look out for the photogenic old oasthouses around Bletchenden and Waterman Quarter. See the list below for a number of other walks near and around Headcorn.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north to Sutton Valence and you can pick up the Greensand Way. This major long distance walk follows the ridge of greensand rock through Surrey and Kent. Here you can also visit the ruins of the 12th century Sutton Valence Castle for some local history. You can then climb up to the castle and enjoy wonderful views over East Sussex and the Weald of Kent. Just to the east there's the worthy village of Smarden to explore. Here you'll find a number of picturesque cottages, an historic 14th century pub and a noteworthy church which has been described as the 'Barn of Kent' due to its high scissor beam roof.

display_address: Rushford Close, Headcorn, Maidstone, Kent, England, TN27 9QD, United Kingdom
